main_definition: Councils refer to groups of people who come together to deliberate, make decisions or provide advice on various issues.

meanings_and_examples.example: The city council provides guidance and suggestions for local policies.
The school board, also known as the education councils, consists of elected members who make important decisions regarding public schools.
After a long debate, the United Nations Security Council passed a resolution to address an international crisis.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of experts convened to discuss and make decisions on specific topics
meanings_and_examples.example: The medical council gathered leading healthcare professionals to formulate guidelines for the pandemic response.
